name: 8.8 "For Real Men Only" Quiz | 'Cheers'- Season 8 | 10 Questions

questions.text: What did Woody say after each memory?
questions.explanation:
"I almost died."

	It sounded like Woody had a horrible childhood yet he sounded as if he enjoyed his childhood. This isn't too surprising that Woody had so much trouble growing up since so many of his relatives were killed or maimed in various accidents as well in Hanover, Indiana.

questions.text: What did Carla have a petition for?
options: to have Eddie inducted into the Hockey Hall of Fame
to keep Gloria from getting anything
to get a better pay working at Cheers
questions.explanation:
to retire Eddie's hockey number.

	She started to forge people's signatures to get enough. However, it didn't work, the people in charge of retiring numbers explained that Eddie wasn't that good of a player. However, they gave her season tickets to the Bruins home games, which she said is what she wanted anyway.

questions.text: What number was Eddie on the Bruins?
questions.explanation:
38.

	Eddie was the goalie for the Bruins. In an earlier episode, he started to do badly and Carla thought she was a jinx so she broke up with him. Then in another episode, he was playing well again when they were planning to get married. Both Carla and Eddie were very superstitious people so Eddie said maybe Carla was right and he was playing badly because of bad luck. However, Carla informed him that he wasn't that good before the bad luck started.

questions.text: What was Frasier and Lilith's baby's name?
questions.explanation:
Frederick.

	Sam called him "Fred Freddy the Fredderman", to which Lilith replied "Frederick". Later on however he was referred to sometimes as Freddy.

The baby.

	A bris is a Jewish ceremony in which a baby boy is circumcised.  It usually happens on the baby's 8th day of life.

questions.text: Who had to throw a retirement party?
questions.explanation:
Rebecca.

	Rebecca was upset because she always got stuck doing these type jobs. The party was not going well at all.

questions.text: Why didn't the guys go to the bris?
questions.correct: They were freaked out at the idea of seeing a circumcision done.
options: They thought that they were the ones being circumcised.
They couldn't agree whose car to take.
questions.explanation:
They were freaked out at the idea of seeing a circumcision done.

	As Carla put it, they were all afraid of a little pain that wasn't even their own. Even Frasier couldn't handle the bris.

questions.text: Why did Frasier say he had a problem with the bris?
questions.correct: "They were about to give my son one hell of a boo-boo."
options: "I'm not Jewish so why should Frederick have to have a bris just because Lilith is Jewish."
"How do you prepare refreshments for something like that?"
"They were about to give my son one hell of a boo-boo."
"Frederick was going to get an owie."
questions.explanation:
"They were about to give my son one hell of a boo-boo."

	Frasier snuck Frederick out of the house and over to Cheers. Lilith came to the bar to talk to him and said, "have you gone completely meshuggina!" They ended up having the bris in the barroom of Cheers.  (Meshuggina is Yiddish for crazy.)

questions.text: Who did Frasier ask how he went back to a room full of people who thought he was an idiot?
questions.explanation:
Cliff.

	Cliff starts to answer him, and then he realizes that Frasier insulted him. He didn't answer the question.

questions.text: Who was the retirement party for?
questions.explanation:
Larry.

	Larry was played by Jay Robinson. He was probably best known for his role as Caligula in the 1953 movie "The Robe". Robinson died on September 27, 2013 of unspecified causes. He was 83 years old.
